article.headline: Temple 70, St. Bonaventure 56
article.story: PHILADELPHIA -- Lavoy Allen scored 20 points, hitting all eight of his shots, and grabbed 18 rebounds, a career-high and Liacouras Center record, in leading Temple to a 70-56 victory over St. Bonaventure on Sunday. Dionte Christmas added 18 points and Ryan Brooks had 12 for Temple (17-9, 9-3 Atlantic 10), which won its fifth in a row. Chris Matthews had 15 points and Malcolm Eleby scored 14 for the Bonnies (13-13, 4-9), who lost to the Owls for the 11th straight time. Allen dominated the first half, as Temple jumped out to an early 17-8 lead and cruised to a 38-26 halftime advantage. The 6-foot-9 sophomore hit all five of his shots in the half, scored 15 points and pulled down 14 rebounds -- one more than the entire St. Bonaventure team. Trailing 48-31 with 16:14 left in the game, the Bonnies went on a 14-3 run, cutting the lead to 51-44. But Temple scored six of the next seven, and the Bonnies never got closer than eight points. Temple leads in the all-time series 49-6, and is 25-0 against St. Bonaventure in games played in Philadelphia.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
